projectPurpose: To provide a framework for building cross-platform desktop and mobile applications using web technologies for the frontend and Rust for the backend, prioritizing small binary size, performance, and security.
mainFeatures: Integrate any web frontend (HTML, JS, CSS)
Rust backend with API for frontend interaction
Uses system webviews instead of bundling browser engine
Built-in app bundler and self updater

alternatives.name: Electron
mainFeatures: Build desktop apps with HTML, CSS, JS

alternatives.name: NW.js
mainFeatures: Call Node.js modules directly from DOM
Write native apps in HTML, CSS, JS

alternatives.name: Flutter
alternatives.license: Open Source - New BSD License / BSD 3-Clause

alternatives.name: Capacitor
mainFeatures: Access to Native SDKs and APIs

marketPositioning: Tauri is positioned as a modern, lightweight, and security-focused alternative to frameworks like Electron and NW.js. It targets developers who want to build cross-platform desktop and mobile applications using web technologies but prioritize smaller binary sizes, lower resource consumption (by using native webviews), and enhanced security features, leveraging the performance benefits of a Rust backend.
